text:
Heating the Honey Stir the violet petals into the half jar of honey. Cover the jar. Use a suitable lid. Place the trivet at the base of the saucepan. Stand the jar on the trivet. Fill the saucepan with water. Fill to the neck of the honey jar. Bring the water to the boil. Reduce heat slightly and let simmer for half an hour (30 minutes). Remove from the heat. Allow to cool. Infusing the Violet Flavor Let the honey sit for one to two weeks. The flavor from the violets will infuse the honey.
